title: Seven-year-old boy holds knife to girl's throat over school dinner pizza row
text:

A seven-year-old boy held a knife to a schoolgirl's throat in a shocking argument over a pizza school dinner, reports say.

The child said 'I'll do it' to the pupil, also seven, as he wielded the blade at The Meads Primary School, in Luton.

The dispute was reportedly sparked by the victim telling the lad not to eat a slice of pizza that had fallen off his plate.

He then grabbed a butter knife and warned the girl 'I'll do it, I will - I'll do it' after she said she would let a teacher know he picked up the slice.

(Image: Getty Images/imageBROKER RF)

The terrified pupil burst into tears and was found by a teacher at around 12.45pm on October 18, with the headteacher later meeting her mum in person.

The 36-year-old mum-of-two was told the boy had been suspended for the day - and she reported the encounter to the police.

She slammed the school for its 'lenient treatment of knife crime', according to The Sun .

She added: "Something has gone seriously wrong if a boy thinks a solution to conflict with a peer is to hold a knife to their throat.

"I was completely shocked and distraught getting that phone call, knowing that my daughter was in floods of tears and inconsolable.

"She's having nightmares about the incident - she can't shake the memory of it.”

(Image: Getty Images)

The mother said she had lost faith in the school's ability to properly deal with unruly pupils.

Meads Primary School headmaster Richard Jenkins reportedly said: "There was a disagreement between two pupils in the school dining room during lunchtime, where one pupil held up an item of cutlery in front of a child's face.

"Staff immediately dealt with the matter in line with our behavioural policy and both children are now back in school."
description: The knife-wielding boy was sent home for the day after threatening a girl at The Meads Primary School, in Luton
